p: Since 1940, many bacterial diseases have begun to be controlled by antibiotics, and since 1960, many viral and bacterial diseases have had vaccines developed for them [ 1]. Unfortunately, we do not have a vaccine for all infectious diseases. As we see in the example of this pandemic, new viruses continue to transfer from other species to us because history has not ended with the advent of our generation. Instead, it just continues, but this pandemic certainly does not look like it will “decimate” us.
